Beautiful brown trout filmed this week in the #Trent at @StaffsUni. Fish of this size may now be reaching this part of the river because the new channel at the Victoria Ground bypasses two weirs, which were a barrier to fish passage. 
@EnvAgencyMids @CraigBennett3 @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/B65vmWzYs9

@amandabarwell @EnvAgencyMids Hi Amanda. If you suspect any fishing activity that is in breach of byelaws (e.g. out of season, illegal methods, taking fish outside permitted dates, etc) then you should always call the EA incident line: 0800 80 70 60 
If you can let us know where (DM if wish) we can raise too

tweets.text: @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids looking for advice on how to stop people repeatedly fishing illegally on river Severn? Local council are just referring me to angling association who say it‚Äôs not up to them as they don‚Äôt own the fishing rights! Happening near an otters nest too ‚òπÔ∏è

Publication of a report we produced for the @EnvAgency to help deliver on the AMR Action Plan 

"Framework for understanding environmental antimicrobial resistance in England" https://t.co/iguV2HJtng https://t.co/Iz9MleX0Nx

Walking today in the beautiful sunshine I met a family also enjoying the magnificent colours. We paused to discuss the dry Ivel Springs. The child listening asked ‚Äú who broke the river?‚Äù So @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency who broke our chalk stream ? https://t.co/Ifth31WjGL

Calling all Shiplake residents! The Thames Farm development saga will get coverage on @BBCSouthNews today at 6.30pm. Please tune in and also visit  https://t.co/CZxLCwGOEW to view the local petition on stopping a local environmental disaster. @henleystandard @EnvAgency

For #FloodActionWeek we‚Äôre asking you to prepare for winter - but we are too! Our flood warning expansion team has added 20000 more properties to our flood warning service- we‚Äôre also adding over 200 telemetry sites producing 137m new data points a year - hydrometric data heaven! https://t.co/9BZWrfgx8U
@WildStoke @StaffsWildlife @StaffsUni @EnvAgencyMids @CraigBennett3 @WildTroutTrust That's fantastic to see in Stoke.

If you're flooded, you won't have much time to prepare. Knowing just one action to take can reduce the effects on your home and family.

It's quick and easy to prepare üëâ https://t.co/a9sZgdRGHP 

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/lPHpsItmss
The U.K. is leading the world when it comes to ocean protection. This is HUGE news üêã üéâ https://t.co/khUjt919zB

Work starts on 23 November to improve flood defences near Phoenix Bridge, Brighouse which was damaged by the floods last February. For more https://t.co/CbrNYxoHvJ

Taking action before a flood could keep the things you care about safe #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/wwueotBnkz https://t.co/fnjabfbTNA

Some useful info from @EnvAgency below.
Worth reading as flooding is becoming more of an issue these days in our current climate. https://t.co/MrYxWHvHTA

I have two exciting opportunities to join my Executive Leadership Team and be at the heart of leading @EnvAgency in creating a better place for people and wildlife. Chief Operating Officer: https://t.co/O14DgMmEkw and Executive Director of Local Operations https://t.co/EzQWNw1xLa

"...the water industry remains one of the biggest polluters of rivers in the country" at the same time as @EnvAgency is de-funded to the point where it is incapable of enforcement #profitsfirst https://t.co/n7tiGFak6y

Data from @CopernicusEU Sentinel satellites are enabling the national monitoring of agricultural activity in #Poland. 
This is a massive task but the use of satellites data will be of great help. 
Read more about the EOStat project here https://t.co/mSBghXK0pc https://t.co/pdKmPx4U7F

tweets.text:
More evidence that the efforts spent cleaning our rivers and coastal seas is paying off - - whoever thought that we would find a small Sunfish washed up on a beach in Merseyside 
@EnvAgencyNW @MarkSewellUU @UUJoHarrison #altcrossens #accp #lmcp @NWFishEA @theriverstrust https://t.co/wTkVsBXYZ2

Join @WEETFEvents to discuss #environmentalstandards. We're delighted to have @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @CLAtweets @DefraGovUK @UniofOxford @BurgesSalmon @GreenAllianceUK speak on the 13th January! Book here: https://t.co/qnbmhuUdnw #onlineconference #environmentbill https://t.co/17HygsINNJ

Join @WEETFEvents to discuss #environmentalstandards. We're delighted to have @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @CLAtweets @DefraGovUK @UniofOxford @BurgesSalmon @GreenAllianceUK speak on the 13th January! Book here: https://t.co/FAGsTc7SSz #onlineconference #environmentbill https://t.co/FCLItmmFkp

Floods can destroy your most treasured possessions.

Taking a few simple steps now can help protect your home and family.

Don‚Äôt lose what you love to a flood: https://t.co/xKGAQ9Oqsr

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/AWlCNioPNv

The first edition of Current Magazine‚Äôs Innovation Supplement is out now, focusing on the use of ground-breaking technology in the delivery of #flood risk management in the UK: https://t.co/3XXYXTE8RI   

#floodaware #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/b6VuxfDeFB

It's #FloodActionWeek, and I've written a blog on how #TeamEA have been preparing for winter - from building & repairing new flood defences, to enhancing our #FloodWarning system and training 6,500 staff: https://t.co/pVdjmzZUIL

The @EnvAgency is ready for winter, are you?

Spot the culvert! Blocked culverts can be a #flood risk. Our field teams are regularly out checking and clearing blocked culverts . We are ready for flooding- are you ready to #PrepareActSurvive a flood this winter? https://t.co/hbQAFTlDjW https://t.co/35sn4qXeea

@JohnAdamsEbble @AndyRT @AmesburyMuseum @PINSgov @UNESCOUK @UNESCO @ICOMOSUK @EnvAgency @holland_tom @grantshapps @CllrWhitehead @BBCr4today Justin Webb @BBCr4today didn‚Äôt exactly probe the #StonehengeTunnel ‚ÄúAre you worried about @UNESCO removing World Heritage status?‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy spend ¬£2bn on a poor value scheme when we‚Äôre hard up‚Äù would have held @grant Shapps to account. #MoneyHenge #EasyRide #SaveStonehenge WHS

tweets.text: @SevernUnlocked @severnrivers @CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids Great that this is happening but architectural whinge coming up: Why can‚Äôt it be well designed too....? That staircase is so close to being elegant but the stepped stringers are criminal . Wouldn‚Äôt have taken much effort to do it right.

It's #FloodActionWeek ‚Äì find out how you can be prepared for flooding. 

Did you know that 5.2 million properties in England are at risk of #flooding? 

Would you know what to do in a flood? 

Do you have a flood plan? 

Find out now: https://t.co/ZEHl74ryiJ 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/0i6jFwlajq

@SaveStonehenge @JohnAdamsEbble @AndyRT @AmesburyMuseum @PINSgov @UNESCOUK @UNESCO @ICOMOSUK @EnvAgency @holland_tom @grantshapps @CllrWhitehead @BBCr4today You can bet your life he won‚Äôt answer  the question, and that the interviewer will let him get away with it.

tweets.text:
üåß It‚Äôs #FloodActionWeek

Would you know how to prepare if you were at risk of flooding? What to do and when to act?

The @EnvAgency have some great tips üëá https://t.co/yLscOSSW7v

It's #FloodActionWeek!

Make sure you know the simple steps to take if a Flood Alert, Flood Warning, or Severe Flood Warning is issued in your area. @EnvAgency https://t.co/Zljs47ZYDw

Sneak peek üëÄ on how the underwater viewing window is taking shape at our Diglis #FishPass. It will be such a special experience - descending those stairs to look out on the fish within the river! üêüüêüüêü @severnrivers @CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids #FishPassage https://t.co/xcNs6OYDvM

great to hear of proposed planting of a plethora of black poplars as part of Peabody's #LivingInTheLandscape at @ThamesmeadLDN @PeabodyLDN - future guardians for the transformation of this amazing 'big blue' town @LDADesign @LDN_environment @WildLondon @Thames21 @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/C12DVt3klJ

The #Ineson2020 Lecture is going virtual!! Save the date: 26th November 4pm-5:30pm. This years lecture, joint with @Geolsoc_hydro& @IAH_Ireland will be delivered by Anne Dacey, DD for Water @EnvAgency, discussing the future of UK #groundwater post-2020. More info to follow soon! https://t.co/wjZHfWZaQu

Flooding is devastating, , but there are small steps you can take to keep you and your family safe and help protect your home or business.  Check your #Floodrisk and sign-up for free . To find out more visit https://t.co/29saU23JrY #FloodActionweek #PrepareActSurvive. üåäüè† https://t.co/6IWfitUqei

Our fisheries officers have responded to an incident in #Warrington of fish in distress due to low levels of oxygen as result of fallen leaves 

Aeration equipment has been deployed to boost oxygen levels & we are working with the Warrington Angling Trust to monitor the situation https://t.co/i2ou2zpIG7

Do you know what to do in a flood? Make sure you know the simple steps to take if a Flood Alert, Flood Warning, or Severe Flood Warning is issued in your area üëá

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/sXatK90YWd

BREAKING: Government approves plan to waste ¬£2.4 billion on massive road tunnel next to Stonehenge!

"Like burning ancient manuscripts", says leading archaeologist.

Disaster for England's heritage and the global climate.
https://t.co/n43OMBIP6n

tweets.text:
@James_BG @WaterUK Meanwhile our chalk streams are still being over abstracted and the water industry remains one of the biggest polluters of rivers in the country.

Tell you what. Keep your Centre of Excellence we'd quite like our rivers back. https://t.co/fOYyMb5gOV

Make sure you know the simple steps to take if a Flood Alert, Flood Warning, or Severe Flood Warning is issued in your area üëá

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft 

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Uj28BuYHVC

For those wondering why on earth the @PINSgov recommended planning approval for the #StonehengeTunnel - they didn‚Äôt! They recommended refusal, which is absolutely the right answer.  Any politician thinking this is a good idea needs their head examining. #judicialreview next. https://t.co/ftBCfPsX8u

There are over 200,000 properties at risk of tidal flooding around the Humber, some of these surprisingly far inland. Don‚Äôt assume it‚Äôs not you. Check your risk! #PrepareActSurvive @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/llOVfU9SUa https://t.co/dQcwz03fP2
